sentences.sContent: He narrowed his eyes and gazed at the horizon.
sentences.sCn: 他眯起眼睛凝望着地平线。

sentences.sContent: The track divided into two and narrowed.
sentences.sCn: 小道分成两条并且变窄了。

sentences.sContent: ...a new way for the middle class to distinguish themselves from what they perceive to be the narrow tastes of those beneath them in the social hierarchy...
...and accessible only by crawling through narrow passageways...
...At the moment candidates are selected on a fairly narrow set of criteria such as prior academic and career performance...
...The narrow strips of beach on which the turtles lay their eggs are being squeezed on one side by development and on the other by the threat of rising sea levels as the oceans warm...

synos.tran: 狭窄的，有限的；勉强的；精密的；度量小的

phrases.pCn: [计]窄带，窄频带；[经]狭小汇率幅度
九死一生，幸免于难；千钧一发

words.tran: 仔细地；勉强地；狭窄地；严密地

trans.tranOther: to make something narrower or to become narrower
